author: @dharmaraja41
text: Hi  The reason why you see random stocks is because you have demo tws and as well, it’s a paper trading account, which will give you some “pretend” money. the cause for your offer retry is because of demo as well. Most likely because you are unable to reach ports I am guessing. Are you sure you explicitly opened the ports in your firewall to IB servers? .. not sure what it is for paper trading I believe in live account the ports are 4001,4002. And 4000 for api to your desktop  https://ibkr.info/article/2816

author: @camtravels1
text: Great video, thanks. Through much frustration I learnt that the demo accounts at IB can behave very differently to the real money accounts - indeed they simply just don't work sometimes. Also be aware that the words bid and offer have very specific meanings in trading - a bid is a buy order, an offer is a sell order. There are no exceptions to this rule. For example "let's make an offer to buy" makes no sense in the trading world.

author: @huiliu6191
text: Interactive Brokers hosted a webinar on Nov. 10 2016 about Implement Algo Trading coded in Python using Interactive Brokers API. The presenter gave a good explanation on the applicability of IBridgePy, which is an open-sourced software used to connect to Interactive Brokers C++ API for execution of python codes in live markets.  The webinar was recorded so that you can listen to it anytime you want. The link of the webinar is here: https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/index.php?f=2227 In the page, IB categorizes their webinars in several topics: TWS, Trading, API, etc. After you click the tab of "API", you will see all of the webinars about API. IBridgePy works like a standalone quantopian and it is much easier than IBpy.

text: This is not the demo version problem. The python API is not perfect - this is just direct, mostly automatic translation from Java API.

author: @treborsol
text: Hi,  tried your programme and had the same problem that ibtws not always works in de placeOrder call. The problem is in the latency of IB. IB is not meant for high frequency trading and the solution to stable interaction is adding the following code:  ... from time import sleep  ...  conn.placeOrder(oid, cont, offer) sleep(1) ...
